intro: Oporanthus colchiciflorus, commonly known as the Colchiciflorous Oporanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features include a taproot system and hairy stems, which help it survive in its native habitat. Oporanthus colchiciflorus is often found in moist, woodland environments and is considered a rare species.
